summary: Tony: it’s 11pm, why are you drinking coffee now? Peter: time is an illusion and once you realise that, you can transcend and...
body:
Tony: it’s 11pm, why are you drinking coffee now?

Peter: time is an illusion and once you realise that, you can transcend and live in bliss

Peter: *takes sip*

Peter: also i have a ten page essay due tomorrow that i haven’t even started yet

HIS STANS ARE THE WORST. THEY SAY THEY LOVE TONY AND YET THEY LIKE MAKING HIM(and me) SUFFER WITH THEIR ANGSTY FANFICS AND FANARTS!!!

summary: tony stark looked beautiful in the early sunshine streaming through the slats of the blinds. his warm, tan skin on display where...
body:
tony stark looked beautiful in the early sunshine streaming through the slats of the blinds. his warm, tan skin on display where the covers dipped low on the curve of his rear.

his messy mop of brown curls flopped over the pillow. lashes fanned out against high cheekbones. in sleep, with all his wrinkles smoothed out, he looked ages younger, peaceful in a way that steve had never seen him awake. he was radiant, practically glowing in post-coital haze.

his arms were tucked under the pillow beneath his head as he snored softly, his nose wrinkling adorably as he shifted into the sunlight. there was a hickey on his neck that he knew tony would be angry about when he found it later. that was one of the terms of their agreement. no visible marks. but steve knew he would come back for more the same way he knew he would always give everything he had to him.

his fingers crossed the bed to skim over tony’s slender shoulder, the lean muscles tensing under steve’s fingertips as he shivered, pressing into the pillow further. steve remembers the days when they used to cuddle. when he’d wake up with coconut-smelling chocolate locks in his face, his arms wrapped around slender hips. but that was a lifetime ago and steve didn’t have a time machine.

he closed his eyes, wishing tony would still be here hours from now, smiling at steve over a mug of coffee. joining steve under the warm spray of the shower. sharing kisses on the balcony as they looked out over the city. he could imagine tony’s smile, touched by the sun as he grinned up at steve like he hung the moon. he would give anything to see that expression on his face, just one last time.

steve wished he would stay longer. just this once.

but he knew better. he knew tony would be gone before the sun rose fully in the sky. back on his private jet to new york. back to reality and the mess of the accords.

and steve could never be okay with it. but he had to be.

he forced himself to be.

title: Astronaut
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Utb79K

by PinkEasterEggs

Spider-Man is invited to Germany by Iron Man to help bring back Team Cap before they go Rogue. But before Spider-Man can help, he’s kidnapped by Ross and imprisoned in The Raft. To complicate matters further, Ross finds out that Spider-Man is actually the teenage son of Tony Stark and Steve Rogers.

Too bad Peter never told his parents about his webbed vigilantism.

summary: Complete and Radiant, Sealed by Fire
title: Complete and Radiant, Sealed by Fire
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2G5NLx1

by daphneblithe

The dream begins the night after Steve’s first treatment. It’s an asthma attack, he’s fighting to breathe, but the cold is new. It sinks into him at a bone level, merciless. His coughing turns to drowning in cold, pale clouds, and he’s locked behind … ice? Glass? He doesn’t know, he’s gasping … and then he wakes.

Words: 4982, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

blog.name: tessainthelife
blog.title: TessaBlu
blog.description: Mexico. 20. College Student. Depression got me. ღ

summary: So, here I come again, Avengers!
body:
So, here I come again, Avengers!

Okay, Marvel fans, I’m telling you this three weeks in advance, so here we go: as someone who works in a movie theater, I’m begging you, at the premiere don’t be an asshole to the people working there!

There are a lot of young people working at the cinemas because they need an income! And these type of movies (the marvel ones) are the hardest for us, movie theater workers. We have to work at midnight and even breakdown because we are needed there to attend the costumers. I’m going to work at the premiere, the last feature is at 2:30 a.m. (at the moment), my shift is going to end at 4:00 a.m. and then I have to go to my 7:00 am class at college, and just like me, there’s lots of workers that have that kind of schedule, so: be patient, know what you want to order, don’t try to sneak to others theaters, be clean!!!! (we, workers, have to stay after the movie ended to clean up the cinema, so please, I know y’all excited but that doesn’t mean you have to leave mountains of popcorn and trash in your seat), be at your best behavior and don’t try to record the film! Let’s have a great time watching the movie and help the movie theater workers have a peaceful end of shift. Maybe there is going to be problems, but let the people who manage the theater solve them and be kind and patient!

Also, if a worker tells you there isn’t more merchandise of the movie, or there isn’t something you want to buy, remember that there’s a lot of people and that’s the reason of why, you aren’t the only one who wants to buy things and it isn’t our fault there isn’t more because merchandise is limited.

Be respectful, don’t try to steal anything (if you want a poster or something like that, you can ask nicely to a manager, and maybe you’ll get it).

Well, enjoy the movie and let’s hope your favorite superhero survive!

blog.name: itismarvelicious
blog.title: Qu'est-ce que j'irais faire au paradis ?
blog.description: French. 25. | Fixing Avengers: Endgame here. | I take prompts. | Pepperony mainly.

summary: Need Tony to tell Pepper “everything will be okay” at the end of Endgame, as a parallel to Iron Man 3 when he tells her “(you’re...
body:
Need Tony to tell Pepper “everything will be okay” at the end of Endgame, as a parallel to Iron Man 3 when he tells her “(you’re in a relationship with me,) everything will never be okay.” This time everything will be okay. They’ll live that peaceful life at last.

Or, alternately, Tony, in a state of total depression at the end of Endgame, says “I don’t know if I’m ever gonna be okay”. And Pepper says with a smile: “Hey. You’re in a relationship with me, everything will be okay.” And the next scene is their wedding.
